p: The family Boraginaceae includes more than 2700 species commonly found in cosmopolitan habitats especially in Tropic, Turian (Iran) and Mediterranean regions [ 1]. Several species from this family has been traditionally used as diuretic, anti-inflammatory, diaphoretic and sedative as well as rheumatic pain and burns [ 2, 3]. From a chemical point of view, the species are characterised by naphthoquinones and its derivatives, pyrrolizidine alkaloids, phenolic compounds and its derivatives [ 4].
